page.title: 10NEWHAVEN AS A TOURIST CENTRE
page.content: It is estimated that one million tourists pass through Newhaven each year. The town is seen as either an entry or exit point: people leave Newhaven to go to various destinations on the Continent while others come into Newhaven to visit other parts of Sussex and England. Although Newhaven is not regarded as an important tourist centre, it does offer facilities for tourists such as guest houses and hotels and is an ideal base for visiting the surrounding area. It has good rail and bus services to London, Lewes, Brighton and Eastbourne. The fort, built in 1868 to protect Newhaven against the French, is a popular attraction, as is the sandy beach near the West Pier.
